alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; McPherson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 12:13AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, eastern Grant, northern Keith, southern Hooker, eastern Garden and western McPherson Counties through 1245 AM CDT/1145 PM MDT/... At 1213 AM CDT/1113 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Whitman to near Swan Lake to near Arthur. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Swan Lake, Whitman, Carr Lake, Haythorn Lake, Lena, Sand Puddin Lake, Flatts, Big Lamunyon Flats, Cogill Lake, Calora, East Cody Lake, Jensen Lake, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Sand Beach Lake, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Three Mile Lake, Velma and Pratt Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 156 and 166. Highway 61 between mile markers 116 and 138. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 194. Highway 97 between mile markers 50 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT/midnight MDT/ for the Panhandle of, southwestern and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; McPherson
